result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin J. Gress was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court will reserve right for expungement under 973.015 upon successful completion of probation

AODA and follow through with recommendations
No use of alcohol
No presence in taverns
Maintain full time employment
DNA sample

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Devin J. Gress in court with attorney Jay Kronenwetter.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 14cf248 and 15CF4.  Plea agreement.14CF248 Plea to ct1 and ct 2 to be dismissed and read in.  15CF4 Amend Ct 1 946.491)(a) plea to both counts.  Probation AODA cost and jail on ct 1.    15CF248 Ct 1 no contest plea.  Ct 2 dismissed and read in.   15CF4 Ct 1 amended by court. Misdemeanor bail jump.   guilty plea entered.  Ct 2 guilty plea.  Plea advisement form reviewed.  Elements reviewed on record.  Court reviews charges and penalties.  Felony conviction rights reviewed.  Constitutional rights reviewed and right to jury trial.  Stipulate to factual basis.  Court finds def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Pleas accepted, Found guilty 14CF248 Ct 1.  15CF4 found guilty  Ct 1 & 2.  Sentencing arguments by State,  14CF248 probation 2 yrs with expungement.  15CF4 probation with 60 days jail on Ct 1  ct 2 probation.   Atty Kronenwetter presents sentencing arguments.  Agreement to 14CF248 and argument for jail time.  Stipulate to 2 days credit.  Brief statement by def.      15CF4 Sentence withheld 2 yrs probations on each count.  14CF248 Court orders sentence withheld probation 2 yrs.   Court will not order any jail time.  Conditions of probation  AODA and follow through with recommendations..  No use of alcohol.  No presence in taverns  100 hrs community service. Cost assessed. Maintain full time employment.  15CF4  Same conditions except for community service hours and  Ct 1 fine 1500.  Bond applied  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  14cf248 Court will reserve right for expungement under 973.015 upon successfully completion of probation.  Felony rights reviewed.  DNA sample 14CF248  Post convictions rights.  14CF248 2 days credit if revoked.  Review hearing scheduled for January 9, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial at 01-08-2016 08:30 am
